etymology.description: phonetic 分(分) (fēn, "divide") + semantic 邑(邑) (yì, "city") = sound based on 分(分) + meaning of city -> ancient place name
etymology.interpretation: The character 邠(bīn, "Bin") combines the phonetic element 分(fēn, "divide") to suggest its sound and the semantic element 邑(yì, "city") to indicate it's a place name, reflecting its use as the name of an ancient city.

examples.chinese: 学者研究邠(學者研究邠)，探寻古地风貌(探尋古地風貌)。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhě yánjiū Bīn, tànxún gǔ dì fēngmào.
examples.english: Scholars study Bin, exploring the ancient landscape.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在邠(考古學家在邠)发现了珍贵遗迹(發現了珍貴遺蹟)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài Bīn fāxiàn le zhēnguì yíjì.
examples.english: Archaeologists discovered precious relics in Bin.
